{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3333627,"name":"","username":"Kerol_8054","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-15T06:42:04.545Z","cooked":"

As team 6948 we are having some issues with swerve drive odometry and pathplanner, the teleop drive works perfectly but for the autonomous odometry, when I go to right it goes to left, and so on. Basically, including rotation everything is reversed, I tried multplying the gyro angle with - as well, didn’t work. Then I somehow got the odometry working, and then the pathplanner was reversed, like goes to left when needed to go to right, and when rotation is half way done it would revert its rotation and rotate to the other way again, I need some assistance: here is our code: Kerol-Dev/FRC-Eagles-2024: Official FRC code for Eagles #6948 2024 (github.com)

Thank you!!

Check to see if your drive motors are inverted correctly. It looks like you are not negating your controller for that. This diagram may be helpful: When to invert? | YAGSL

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-15T11:08:15.966Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":18.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458744,"topic_slug":"odometry-and-pathplanner-issues","display_username":"ErikSLee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://yagsl.gitbook.io/yagsl/configuring-yagsl/when-to-invert#spin-your-module-counterclockwise","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"When to invert? | YAGSL","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Milwaukee Robotics Academy, 2830, 8802, 9425, 9760, 10287 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/odometry-and-pathplanner-issues/458744/2","custom_user_title":"Milwaukee Robotics Academy, 2830, 8802, 9425, 9760, 10287 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3333684,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-15T12:33:26.862Z","cooked":"

First things first, before you get to PathPlanner, make sure your odometry is correct.

When the robot turns Counter Clockwise your gyro should increase, and Clockwise the gyro decreases.

Then make sure that if the robot drives 1 meter in the positive direction (that’s from the blue alliance side, toward the red alliance side) the encoders report that you drove 1 meter in the positive direction. This can be done by just pushing the robot, you don’t need a controller to do this.

Once you’re there, the odometry is correct.

Then you can build your paths in Pathplanner on the Blue Alliance side, and verify they work. Then you need to take care of making sure you maintain Always Blue Origin with your autos, then Pathplanner can do the auto-flipping for you.
